Description: Typical range for delicate ceramics like terracotta to avoid thermal damage; starting at 50W for light contamination removal. Max safe ~200W to prevent cracking. Source: Studies on Nd:YAG laser cleaning of archaeological ceramics (e.g., Verges-Belmin et al., 2008, J. Cult. Herit.).
Near-infrared wavelength optimized for Terracotta absorption and minimal substrate damage
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control and adequate energy density
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage and thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant removal with controlled thermal penetration
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning and process efficiency
Recommended number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning coverage without excessive thermal buildup
